wikipedia_page.main: James Fox MBE (born 2 May 1992) is a British Paralympic rower who is a five time World champion and a Paralympic champion in the mixed coxed four Paralympic events. He started rowing when he was eleven.He started his career at the Peterborough City Rowing Club. Fox broke his back in a car accident shortly after starting university.Fox attended the University of London where he rowed for the University of London Boat Club (ULBC).
